channel.description: Recent content in Shaken on Sidecar

item.title: Little Bit Bittah
item.description: 2 oz vodka½ oz Campari1½ oz grapefruit juice½ oz grenadinegrapefruit wedge Shake vodka, Campari, grapefruit juice, and grenadine. Strain into rocks glass over ice. Garnish with grapefruit wedge.

item.title: Margarita
item.description: If you’re feeling extra adventurous, muddle one or two slices of jalapeño in your shaker before adding the ingredients. 2 oz tequila¾ oz orange liqueur¾ oz lime juice¼ oz agave syrup1 pinch of salt Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.

item.title: Cherry on Top
item.description: 6 fresh cherries, pitted1½ oz vodka½ oz Luxardo Maraschino¾ oz lemon juice¼ oz simple syrup Muddle five cherries in the bottom of your cocktail shaker. Add the liquids and ice. Shake. Double strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Set a cherry atop the ice as a garnish.

item.title: Bannon Tantrum
item.description: “The media should keep its mouth shut and just listen for awhile”—Steve Bannon throwing a tantrum on Jan 26, 2017 This must be made with Dry Fly brand vodka; It has an amazing wheat flavor and I created this recipe specifically to let it shine. 2 oz Dry Fly vodka½ oz meyer lemon juice½ oz simple syrup Add everything to a shaker with ice. Shake. Strain into a rocks glass over ice.

item.title: Indian Winter
item.description: This uses honey syrup infused with cardomom pods. 1½ oz vodka½ oz lemon juice½ oz honey cardamom syrup1 egg white2 drops Angostura bitters1 star anise Add vodka, lemon juice, syrup, and egg white to a shaker. Dry shake, then add ice and shake. Double-strain into a coupe glass. Add a couple drops of Angostura bitters on top of the foam (for aroma). Float the star anise atop the drink.

item.title: Bees Knees
item.description: 2 oz gin¾ oz lemon juice¾ oz honey syruplemon twist Add gin, lemon juice, and honey syrup to a cocktail shaker. Shake. Strain into coupe glass. Garnish with lemon twist.

item.title: Blanc-arita
item.description: 2 oz silver tequila½ oz blanc vermouth½ oz lime juice½ oz agave syrup1 dash orange bitters Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice.

item.title: Blushing Betty
item.description: 1½ oz bourbon1 oz grapefruit juice½ oz simple syrupgrapefruit twist Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with grapefruit twist.

item.title: Brandy Alexander
item.description: 2 oz Cognac or other brandy1 oz heavy cream½ oz demerara syrupfresh grated nutmeg Add brandy, cream, and demerara syrup to a cocktail shaker. Shake. Strain into coupe glass. Top with grated nutmeg.

item.title: Daiquiri
item.description: 2 oz white rum¾ oz lime juice¾ oz simple syrup Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake well and strain into a coupe glass.

item.title: Maple Leaf
item.description: The recipe where I found this drink said, “drink on a porch with an old dog.” It’s solid advice. 2 oz bourbon¾ oz real maple syrup¾ oz lemon juicecinnamon stick Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into rocks glass over crushed ice. Garnish with cinnamon stick.

item.title: Vigo
item.description: I didn’t invent this drink, but I did invent the name. 2 oz orange juice1 oz London dry gin1 oz blanc vermouth¼ oz honey syrup2 oz sparkling wine Add all ingredients except the sparkling wine to a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice. Shake then strain into a wine glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Be disappointed by Mimosas for the rest of your life.

item.title: Sidecar
item.description: The simple syrup isn’t traditional, but that’s how I learned it, and I like the touch of additional sweetness. 2 oz Cognac¾ oz orange liqueur¾ oz lemon juice¼ oz simple syruporange twist, discarded Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a coupe glass. Express the oils from an orange twist over the drink, then discard the peel.
